title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Starbucks is considering only external candidates for its next chief executive officer, as interim CEO Schultz said the firm needs to add new talent and skills to its senior ranks.

Carl Icahn is dropping a proxy fight focused on the treatment of pregnant pigs at grocery chain Kroger after concluding he is likely to lose as he did a similar fight at McDonald's last month.

"Top Gun: Maverick," the sequel to the 1986 classic, made an estimated $86 million in the U.S. and Canada over the weekend, following a record-breaking debut.

Revlon began talks with lenders ahead of looming debt maturities to try to steer the business clear of bankruptcy, according to people familiar with the matter.

A Citigroup trader who sent European stock indexes into free fall last month went through several alerts before his order went live, people familiar with the matter said.

Apple's Cook will open the iPhone maker's annual weeklong developer conference on Monday.

What's News: Business & Finance
